subject: RE: [junit] help
msgSnippet: If your method doesn t return a value, it should have a side effect, so test the side effect.  If your method doesn t return anything or have a side effect,
messageBody:
If your method doesn't return a value, it should have a side effect, so test
the side effect. If your method doesn't return anything or have a side
effect, it's not doing anything.

Testing getters and setters is probably not necessary though.

-----Original Message-----
From: javalist [mailto:myjavalist@...]
Sent: Thursday, October 09, 2003 9:50 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] help


hi all:
I am new user to junit . there is a question confuse me. Whether i must
write testcode for a method without return value. If it is necessary ,how to
write ? Thanks you.
for example:
public class Demo1
{
private String strName;
public void setName(String str)
{
strName = str;
}
......
}
whether i must use junit to test setName function.
best regards
penpals
